title.rendered: Cristiano Ronaldo left heartbroken after losing to Al-Hilal

content.rendered:
Cristiano Ronaldo trumped to water when al-NASR won the al-hilal and last Saudi cups on May 31 (Friday). Al Nassr stopped al-helal in the previous, but the hard game is inherited in the al-Hille appears in the redeemable, stores the name of the Rondo. Al-Hilal won 5-4 on penalties, finishing one in the cup double. The match in Jeddah ended 1-1 in regulation time, and there was no winner in extra time.

Despite scoring a goal in the penalty shootout, the Portuguese striker couldn’t prevent his team from losing, ending the season without a trophy. Renowned for his passion and dedication to the sport, the 39-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo could not contain his emotions and shed tears. The gruesome video quickly spread on the Internet, attracting people’s attention.

A dramatic penalty shoot-out decides the final of the Saudi Kings Cup

After a 1-1 draw after 120 minutes, the match went to penalties to determine the winner. Cristiano Ronaldo managed to convert the second shot for Al-Nassr, following the failure of Alex Telles in his first attempt. However, Al-Nemer’s foul on the seventh penalty sealed Al-Nassr’s fate.

Lluis Castro was looking to win this goal when Abdulhamid missed Al-Hilal’s goal. However, Ali Alhassan’s attempt at goal was blocked as Bono anticipated his move and slotted in well to his left.

Aldawsari restored Al Hilal’s lead with a subsequent penalty, before the Moroccan goalkeeper made his second crucial save, ultimately deciding the series’ outcome.

Read Also: Cristiano Ronaldo Sets Record as First to Score 35 Goals in a Single Season.
